intro: Miconia johnwurdackiana, commonly known as the Wurdack's miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other regions, though it can become invasive in some areas.
